Falafel
Batter
200g Split Fava beans
50g Spring Onions
50g Leeks
30g Coriander
30g Parsley
2 Cloves of garlic
1 Tsp Dried Coriander
3/4 Tsp Cumin
1/2 Tsp Black Pepper
1/4 Tsp Cayenne
10g salt
1l vegetable oil for frying
Topping
1 tbsp Coriander seeds
1 tbsp Sesame seeds
Tahini 15g in one third of mix
baking soda 1/3tsp in one third of mix
  1. Soak the beans overnight, and then drain
  2. Roughly chop the greens and herbs, and then combine all the batter ingredients in a large bowl
  3. Chop everything very finely in a food processor, adding a little water if necessary
  4. Beat thoroghly with an electric whisk until the batter aquires a mousse like consistency
  5. Making the balls either by spooning straight into the oil or using the method here. The video method is actually much easier than it looks
Notes
  • How you form the balls will have a big effect on the texture, so avoid squeezing them into balls as they'll be densers
  • This recipe is for egyptian style falafel or ta'ameya
